Key Match Events: The Dodgers stormed back from a 5-run deficit to win the game 7-6
Freddie Freeman tied a World Series record with 12 RBIs
Mookie Betts brought in the winning run with a sacrifice fly in the 8th inning
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers will finally get their parade after winning their 8th championship in franchise history
The Yankees' defense collapsed in the 5th inning with several errors and misplays
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' relentlessness paid off as they wore down the Yankees' pitching staff and created cracks to slip through
The Yankees' bullpen struggled in the game, with Clay Holmes, Tommy Kahnle, and Luke Weaver all giving up runs
Others: The game was played at Yankee Stadium
The Dodgers won the World Series in 2020 during a pandemic but could not hold a parade due to pandemic restrictions
